intro: Anacamptis longicornu subsp. tlemcenensis, commonly known as the Tlemcen orchid, is a rare orchid species native to the Maghreb region of North Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its floral structure includes a distinctive lip that is elongated and often adorned with intricate patterns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
